definition: gauge that is held against an object to judge thickness, diameter etc, such as a feeler gauge, calipers etc/(abbr. for 評價量規|评价量规[ping2 jia4 liang2 gui1]) rubric (i.e. a guide listing specific criteria for grading)
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
rubric (i.e. a guide listing specific criteria for grading)

sentences.english: Only the weight of the gauge itself shall be used in the test.
sentences.chinese: 检验仅利用量规本身的重量进行。

sentences.english: Tighten clamp screw and install scale assembly.
sentences.chinese: 安装量规部件前旋紧制动螺钉。

sentences.english: Now you can download the sheet of evaluation and then give yourself a mark.
sentences.chinese: 对照评估里的量规表为自己打个分吧。

sentences.english: Move dial gauge to cylinder liner record reading on dial gauge.
sentences.chinese: 移动针盘量规到汽缸套，记录针盘量规上读数。

sentences.english: Move dial gauge to cylinder liner record reading on dial gauge.
sentences.chinese: 移动针盘量规到汽缸套，记录针盘量规上读数。

sentences.english: Use the following three-point rubric to evaluate students' work during this lesson.
sentences.chinese: 采用下面三分制量规对本课中学生的工作打分。
